result.execSummary:
All charges against Andrew J Werchowski in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew J Werchowski is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew J Werchowski in court, in custody, with attorney Aaron R Anderson.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

For reasons stated on the record, the State moves to dismiss case. Defense has no objection. 

Court dismisses case. 

Defendant to be transfered to DCI forthwith.
Letter from DDA Thurston advising that the State intends to dismiss this matter at the next hearing.

Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Andrew J Werchowski in court, in custody, with attorney Aaron R Anderson.  Hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
